Other Information.Additional Info: The Zn-MOFs layer allows ascorbic acid to pass through while blocking macromolecular substances such as enzymes.
Macromolecular substances such as enzymes are blocked by the Zn-MOFs layer due to their larger size.

Experimental Validation.Method: SERS spectral response and anti-interference testing
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Detection limit: 0.38 U/L for alkaline phosphatase activity; Consistent SERS signals in the presence of interferences.

Other Information.Additional Info: The Zn-MOFs were electrochemically deposited on an AuNPs/AAO substrate, providing a uniform mesoporous layer with a mean pore size of 2.8 nm. The material exhibited strong anti-interference performance and stability during detection-regeneration cycles.
